articles.author: Associated Press
articles.title: China beats South Korea to win Women's Asian Cup - The Washington Post
articles.description: China came from two goals down to defeat South Korea 3-2 on Sunday and win the Women’s Asian Cup for a record ninth time
articles.content: At half-time I told the players not to give up as anything can happen in 45 minutes, said China coach Shui Qingxia, who won the title five times as a player. We are delighted to win the title and we … [+1536 chars]

articles.title: China seek ninth Asian title as they face South Korea in final - South China Morning Post
articles.description: Captain Wang Shanshan is happy to be China’s role model, saying extending their record was important to the players.

articles.author: Nick D’Urbano
articles.title: ‘Why not?’: Victory aren’t done yet - NEWS.com.au
articles.description: Winning the FFA Cup is one thing but beating Japanese heavyweights Vissel Kobe in a do-or-die Asian Champions League playoff is another but Melbourne Victory coach Tony Popovic is asking – “why not?”
articles.content: Melbourne Victory have risen from misery to ecstasy in less than a year and the side believes it can keep up its winning ways overseas.Winning the FFA Cup is one thing but beating Japanese heavyweigh… [+3967 chars]
